frame.name: Social_interaction_evaluation
frame.definition:
<def-root>In this frame an <fen>Evaluee</fen> is judged by a (usually implicit) <fen>Judge</fen> to be of a certain character based on her or his <fen>Behavior</fen> towards other human beings; a specific <fen>Affected_party</fen> may be overtly mentioned along with the <fen>Degree</fen> to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> behaves appropriately towards others. The<fen>Behavior</fen> alone may be mentioned with the understanding that these behaviors characterize a property of the unmentioned <fen>Evaluee</fen>. The <fen>Evaluee</fen>'s <fen>Behavior</fen> may be in the context of a <fen>Topic</fen>.
<ex> It was <t>nice</t> <fex name="Evaluee">of you</fex> <fex name="Behavior">to send a card</fex>. </ex>
<ex> <fex name="Evaluee">Jim</fex> was <t>thoughtful</t> <fex name="Behavior">to email the directions</fex>.</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Behavior">For Martha to smoke in the car</fex> was <fex name="Degree">extremely</fex> <t>inconsiderate</t>.</ex>
<ex> It was <t>cruel</t> <fex name="Behavior">that he continued to call her</fex>.</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Evaluee">Mary</fex> was <t>cruel</t> <fex name="Affected_party">to her friends</fex>.</ex>
<ex> Samson was a <t>thoughtless</t> <fex name="Evaluee">person</fex>.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Evaluee">Mrs. Robinson</fex> was always <t>considerate</t> <fex name="Affected_party">of her students</fex>.</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Evaluee">The press</fex> was always <t>kind</t> <fex name="Topic">about Madonna</fex>.</ex>
<ex> <fex name="Evaluee">Lee</fex> was <t>nice</t> <fex name="Topic">about my car accident</fex>.</ex>
<ex> I appreciated his <t>kind</t> <fex name="Behavior">offer of the car</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Evaluee
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Evaluee</fen> is the person whose <fen>Behavior</fen> towards other human beings is being evaluated.</def-root>

FE.name: Affected_party
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Affected_party</fen> is the entity which is positively or negatively treated by the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Behavior
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Behavior</fen> is the action of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> on which the evaluation of the <fen>Evaluee</fen>'s character is based.</def-root>

FE.name: Degree
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Degree</fen> is the extent to which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> exhibits the particular <fen>Behavior</fen> towards others.</def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the situation or person that the <fen>Evaluee</fen>'s <fen>Behavior</fen> responds to or is related to.</def-root>

FE.name: Expressor
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Evaluee</fen>.
<ex>She flashed me a <t>kind</t> <fex name="Expressor">smile</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Manner</fen> is the way in which the <fen>Evaluee</fen> embodies the characteristic ascribed to her or him.
<ex><fex name = "Evaluee">Lester</fex> was <fex name = "Manner">coldly</fex> <t>polite</t>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Judge
FE.definition:
<def-root>The individual whose point of view is taken in assigning the evaluation denoted by the target.
<ex><fex name="jud">In my book</fex>, that wasn't very <t>gracious</t>.</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: inconsiderate.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: thoughtlessly causing hurt or inconvenience to others.

lexUnit.name: kind.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: considerate and generous.

lexUnit.name: considerate.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: careful not to harm or inconvenience others

lexUnit.name: mean.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: cruel or unkind

lexUnit.name: insensitive.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: showing or feeling no concern for others' feelings.

lexUnit.name: thoughtless.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not showing consideration for other people.

lexUnit.name: thoughtful.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: showing regard for other people.

lexUnit.name: cruel.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: disregarding or taking pleasure in the pain or suffering of others.

lexUnit.name: sweet.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a person or action) pleasant and kind or thoughtful.

lexUnit.name: rude.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: offensively impolite or ill-mannered.

lexUnit.name: impolite.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not having or showing good manners.

lexUnit.name: ill-mannered.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having bad manners

lexUnit.name: churlish.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: rude, mean-spirited, and surly

lexUnit.name: discourteous.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: rude and lacking consideration for others

lexUnit.name: unkind.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: inconsiderate and harsh

lexUnit.name: courteous.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: polite, respectful, and considerate.

lexUnit.name: polite.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: respectful and considerate of other people.

lexUnit.name: impudent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not showing due respect for another person; impertinent.

lexUnit.name: respectful.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: showing deference and respect

lexUnit.name: disrespectful.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: showing a lack of consideration and respect for others

lexUnit.name: boorish.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: crudely insensitive to other's feelings

lexUnit.name: compassionate.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: showing concern for the suffering of others

lexUnit.name: nice.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a person) good-natured; kind.

lexUnit.name: friendly.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: being judged as being sociable

lexUnit.name: unfriendly.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not friendly.

lexUnit.name: amiable.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: friendly and pleasant in manner.

lexUnit.name: sociable.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: marked by friendliness.

lexUnit.name: cordial.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: warm and friendly.

lexUnit.name: genial.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: friendly and cheerful.

lexUnit.name: gracious.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: courteous, kind, and pleasant.

lexUnit.name: ungracious.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not gracious.

lexUnit.name: civil.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: courteous and polite.

lexUnit.name: uncivil.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: discourteous; impolite.

lexUnit.name: impertinent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: not showing due respect for another person; impertinent.

lexUnit.name: tactful.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: having or showing sensitivity to the feelings of others.

lexUnit.name: diplomatic.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: tactful.

lexUnit.name: barbaric.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: savagely cruel.

lexUnit.name: spiteful.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: showing a desire to hurt, annoy or offend others

lexUnit.name: pleasant.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: (of a person) friendly and considerate; likeable.

lexUnit.name: horrible.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: very disagreeable or unpleasant

lexUnit.name: good.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: kind, benevolent or socially correct.

lexUnit.name: good-natured.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: Having an easygoing, cheerful disposition.

lexUnit.name: good-humored.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: without ill-will.

lexUnit.name: warm.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: having or showing enthusiasm, affection, or kindness.

lexUnit.name: smart.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: disrespectful and bold

lexUnit.name: mature.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: behaving in a manner typical of individuals considered to be mentally or emotionally well-developed

lexUnit.name: maturity.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: quality of behaving in a manner typical of individuals considered to be mentally or emotionally well-developed

lexUnit.name: cruelty.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: disregard or pleasure in the the suffering of others

lexUnit.name: thoughtfulness.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: quality of being considerate of others wants or needs

lexUnit.name: rudeness.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: deliberate disrespect of others social expectations

lexUnit.name: compassion.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the display of concern for the suffering of others

lexUnit.name: atrocious.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: extremely unpleasent
